{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3584404,"name":"Haydar Haspolat","username":"Haydar","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/h/d6d6ee/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-08T22:26:13.421Z","cooked":"

We are switching to Grip Lock Tires from regular treads for our mk4is. I will buy the 4 tire pack kit with the hubs. Do I need to do something else for this? Quick response will be appreciated.

image1079×927 63.3 KB

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-04-08T22:26:13.421Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":14,"reads":175,"readers_count":174,"score":105.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":498496,"topic_slug":"vex-grip-lock-tires-fitting-question","display_username":"Haydar Haspolat","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53072,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/vex-grip-lock-tires-fitting-question/498496/1","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3584467,"name":"Brennyn","username":"Prinkle","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/prinkle/{size}/258824_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-08T23:11:47.781Z","cooked":"

the kit has almost everything. You still need the ring gear that should come with the module. We found that the silver bolts (even with Loctite) tend to back out and will lock up a module. We used black oxide coated bolts with Loctite and we haven’t had a issue.

Btw, do NOT over tighten them because the wheel will squish down.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-04-08T23:12:54.330Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":141,"readers_count":140,"score":43.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":498496,"topic_slug":"vex-grip-lock-tires-fitting-question","display_username":"Brennyn","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55024,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"862 VPE / Driver"},"post_url":"/t/vex-grip-lock-tires-fitting-question/498496/2","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3584486,"name":"s-neff","username":"s-neff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/s-neff/{size}/9062_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-08T23:25:17.211Z","cooked":"

Literally is that easy.

Use the V2 tread, relegate v1 to practice. The tread style really likes full weight robots, ballast up to full weight if you are underweight and if your drive motor gearing can take it. (We found Kraken to work fine with L3)

If you buy more wheel bearings and bevels you can have the old wheels fully built and ready to swap back in, otherwise it’s a few minutes to get all the bearings out and bevel swapped. Not particularly worth the ten minutes saved, you should be fine on one set of all of that.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-04-08T23:28:07.197Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":126,"readers_count":125,"score":45.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":498496,"topic_slug":"vex-grip-lock-tires-fitting-question","display_username":"s-neff","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28019,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/vex-grip-lock-tires-fitting-question/498496/3","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3584506,"name":"FrankJ","username":"FrankJ","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/frankj/{size}/5392_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-08T23:35:05.084Z","cooked":"

Straight forward switch out. Just don’t loose the little spacers that comes with the wheel set.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-04-08T23:35:22.545Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":106,"readers_count":105,"score":36.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":498496,"topic_slug":"vex-grip-lock-tires-fitting-question","display_username":"FrankJ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":15944,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2974 Robot Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/vex-grip-lock-tires-fitting-question/498496/4","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3584519,"name":"Brennyn","username":"Prinkle","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/prinkle/{size}/258824_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-08T23:42:04.933Z","cooked":"

We use V2 to practice as well to make sure that our auto is as close as comp as possible. we can see that with the V1 tends to sway the robot with the squish of the wheel.

Thanks for the responds guys, only thing that confused me is that you mentioned v1’s. Why did you mentioned them? I believe that we won’t be having any v1s, am I correct?

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-04-08T23:48:58.796Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":75,"readers_count":74,"score":20.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":498496,"topic_slug":"vex-grip-lock-tires-fitting-question","display_username":"Haydar Haspolat","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":28019,"username":"s-neff","name":"s-neff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/s-neff/{size}/9062_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53072,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/vex-grip-lock-tires-fitting-question/498496/6","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3584546,"name":"s-neff","username":"s-neff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/s-neff/{size}/9062_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-08T23:51:03.063Z","cooked":"

For a long time the 4 wheel hub kits shipped as a single box with the V1 tires inside. So you used to actually receive eight treads instead of 4 if you order a V2 tread kit with hubs.

Maybe they’ve worked through the back stock by now, maybe not.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-04-08T23:51:29.391Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":68,"readers_count":67,"score":13.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":498496,"topic_slug":"vex-grip-lock-tires-fitting-question","display_username":"s-neff","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":53072,"username":"Haydar","name":"Haydar Haspolat","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/h/d6d6ee/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28019,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/vex-grip-lock-tires-fitting-question/498496/7","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3584557,"name":"Travis Takashima","username":"ttakashima4270","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/b2d939/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-09T00:02:16.736Z","cooked":"

You get a pack of shim washers with the set as well; however, I would suggest ordering more from McMaster-Carr (McMaster-Carr). We have found that using two shim washers over one leads to better spacing where the bevel gears interface.
